Letters to the Editor

Impeachment: Is that all there is?

July 6, 2024

DEAR EDITOR: Some may see it as just another day in Paradise. I can remember when I first became involved in politics. It was 1974, Richard Nixon was going to be impeached — Watergate. He resigned and ended his presidency. I said to myself, “Is that all there is to Nixon’s ...

Don’t focus on cold; Look at leadership

July 6, 2024

DEAR EDITOR: Joe Biden gave a weak performance in his June 27 debate with Donald Trump. Don’t look at just those 90 minutes as failed versus his 51 years in public service! It’s simply this — the leader of the free world was sick. President Biden had a cold, which gave him a slow ...

How dare Trump malign the president

July 6, 2024

DEAR EDITOR: Amazingly, an out-of-office failed president, convicted felon, convicted sexual predator, serial philanderer, multiple bankrupt and leader of a failed insurrection based on his lies that if he did not win the election, it was rigged, now seeks to malign a sitting president by ...

‘Resignation’ of the Rev. Michael Swierz

July 6, 2024

DEAR EDITOR: Last month, following our 4 p.m. Mass at St. Patrick Church in Hubbard, a letter from Bishop Bonnar was read announcing that Father Michael Swierz had resigned as pastor. He also resigned as president of the St. Anthony School and the position of dean of Trumbull County. The ...

See something, then say something

July 6, 2024

DEAR EDITOR: Recently in Coitsville Township, I was walking across the road to get my rural mail and Vindicator at the mailbox. Suddenly, a white pick-up truck with double wheels on the back came barreling down the road at a fast rate. I had my eyes on lookout for the truck, since I could ...

Sound off! Readers share their thoughts

July 6, 2024

Trump said he would stack the courts, he did. Using threats in primary elections he took control of all Republicans, it worked. Using wealth, he slowed all criminal cases against him, it worked. He expressed a desire to be president for life and with the immunity case going in his favor, in the ...
